column1: The majority of the cadets had their dormitories on the second floor of the building. Each room held from four to eight students
column2: and was both bright and clean. The rules of Putnam Hall were similar to those in force at West Point
column3: and every pupil was expected to keep his clothing
column5: and his other possessions in perfect order. Each had a cot
column7: and a clothes closet to himself
column8: extra closets having been introduced in the rooms for that purpose
column9: and each was allowed the use of his trunk in addition. Each cadet had to take his turn at keeping the room in order
column10: although the dormitories were given a regular sweeping and cleaning once a week by the servants.As before
column11: the Rover boys were placed in one room
column12: and into this came also Larry Colby
column14: and George Granbury. The apartment was at an angle of the building
column15: and next to it was another occupied by Songbird Powell
column18: and three other cadets. Between the two rooms was a door
column20: and was supposed to be kept locked.
